item.title: Hello World
item.description:
I am a Ph.D. Student in Public Administration at the Department of Public Policy, Management and Analytics at the University of Illinois Chicago (UIC). I am an affiliated student of the Networks and Governance Lab at UIC.Hi! My name is Jahun lee, and I am an Ph.D. Student in the Department of Public Policy, Management, and Analytics at the University of Illinois Chicago. My research focuses on local governance, in particular, how local governments interact with others to enhance their performance and improve outcomes for their communities. This includes relationships with other governments, private organizations, particularly nonprofits.Currently, I have interests in the influence of demographic shifts on local governance.
I received my PhD in Public Administration and Public Policy at the School of Public Affairs at Arizona State University, where I worked as a research associate at the Center for Science, Technology, and Environmental Policy Studies (C-STEPS). Before moving to the US, I lived in Italy, Paris and Brussels. I got my MPA from University of Seoul (Korea). 
You can find out more about my research by navigating this website.

item.title: Research Interest
item.description: title: "Research Interests" description: | My research primarily focuses on urban governance which consists of various choices of different actors. Particularly, I concentrate on collaborations of local governments with third parties to understand patterns and mechanisms in urban context. title: "Projects in Development" ref: "Lee, J. Local public managers’ choice of service delivery mode"
